popt4jlib.neural

Interface OutputNNNodeIntf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NNNodeIntf, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalXEntropyLoss, CategoricalXEntropyLossW, HardThres, InputSignalMaxPosSelector, Linear, MultiClassSSE, Quadratic, ReLU, Sigmoid, SoftPlus

    public interface OutputNNNodeIntf
extends NNNodeIntf
    common interface for a Neural Network node that can be used as hidden or output layer node.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset, double true_lbl)
      same as NNNodeIntf.eval(inputs,weights,offset) but accepts a 4th argument holding the real class label (as a number).
      double evalB(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset, double true_lbl)
      same as NNNodeIntf.evalB(inputs,weights,offset) but accepts a 4th argument holding the real class label (as a number).

      • Methods inherited from interface popt4jlib.neural.NNNodeIntf

        addPreviousWeightsRange, eval, eval, evalB, evalB, evalPartialDerivativeB, evalPartialDerivativeB, getDirectInputWeightEndIndex, getDirectInputWeightStartIndex, getFFNN4TrainB, getNodeLayer, getNodeName, getPositionInLayer, getTotalNumWeights, isDropout, isWeightVariableAntecedent, setDropout, setFFNN4TrainB, setNodeLayer, setPositionInLayer, setTotalNumWeights, setWeightRange

    • Method Detail

      • eval

        double eval(double[] inputSignals,
            double[] weights,
            int offset,
            double true_lbl)
        same as NNNodeIntf.eval(inputs,weights,offset) but accepts a 4th argument holding the real class label (as a number).
        Parameters:
        inputSignals - double[]
        weights - double[] array holding all the network weights
        offset - int position where the weights for this node start
        true_lbl - double the real label for the input data described in the vector inputSignals
        Returns:
        double

      • evalB

        double evalB(double[] inputSignals,
             double[] weights,
             int offset,
             double true_lbl)
        same as NNNodeIntf.evalB(inputs,weights,offset) but accepts a 4th argument holding the real class label (as a number).
        Parameters:
        inputSignals - double[]
        weights - double[] array holding all the network weights PLUS node biases
        offset - int position where the weights for this node start
        true_lbl - double the real label for the input data described in the vector inputSignals
        Returns:
        double
